Same configuration worked under 1.3.26. Now under 1.3.29, the following happens.

# snip httpd.conf
RewriteEngine   on
RedirectMatch   /share$        
http://photos.fotango.com/cgi-bin/display_share_login.cgi
RedirectMatch   /share/        
http://photos.fotango.com/cgi-bin/display_share_login.cgi
RewriteLog      "/tmp/rewrite.log"
RewriteLogLevel 4
RewriteRule ^/p/(.*)       "http://photos.fotango.com/p/$1"  [R,L]
RewriteRule ^/cgi-bin/(.*) "http://photos.fotango.com/cgi-bin/$1"  [R,L]
RewriteRule ^/adm/(.*)      http://photos.fotango.com/adm/$1  [R,L]
RewriteRule ^/admin/(.*)    http://photos.fotango.com/admin/$1  [R,L]
# snip


And from the rewrite log:

# snip
(2) init rewrite engine with requested uri /p/eba00407742f00000032.jpg
(3) applying pattern '^/p/(.*)' to uri '/p/eba00407742f00000032.jpg'
(2) rewrite /p/eba00407742f00000032.jpg -> http://photos.fotango.com/p/
(2) explicitly forcing redirect with http://photos.fotango.com/p/
(1) escaping http://photos.fotango.com/p/ for redirect
(1) redirect to http://photos.fotango.com/p/ [REDIRECT/302]
# snip


It appears that the math occurs, but the third line of the log doe snot have the
content of $1 appended.

Sorry Andre, but the data I was looking for cant be found. I was told by the
Perl 5.6 release manager, and he can't remember any more details than 'its a
problem'. The workaround I posted is only good for when no path rewriting is
going on. I think formt he config line I posted, and the snippets of mod_rewrite
log file in there, you can see the mod_rewrite starting to rewrite ^/p/(.*) to
its new URL, but then completely not setting the $1 as should be done fromt he
config file snippet. I should think you can see this is a bug. I followed the
exact instructions with mod_perl INSTALL.siple.mod_ssl.

I am building everything statically. Hope this helps.

I have also encoutered this behaviour (mod_rewrite backreferences do not work
when mod_perl is present) using Apache 1.3.34 (+ mod_info + mod_rewrite +
mod_proxy) + mod_perl 1.29 (static build on Fedora Core 3).

Using rules (in the only virtual server in httpd.conf):

RewriteEngine on

RewriteRule ^/external/back-reference/(machine.txt)$ /$1 [redirect=permanent,last]

... a request to .../external/back-reference/machine.txt is redirected to .../
(instead of .../machine.txt).

Hoveover, some older Apache (1.3.27 (?) - not sure) and/or mod_perl versions
supported backreferences well.

Are there any plans/workarounds to fix this behaviour?
